definitions.definition: to move along by putting one foot in front of the other, allowing each foot to touch the ground before lifting the next:
to go with someone to a particular place, for example because you want to protect them from danger, or show them the way:
examples: He offered to walk her home/to the station.

definitions.definition: to take an animal, especially a dog, for a walk:
examples: She walks the dog for an hour every afternoon.

definitions.definition: someone who seems to be a human form of disaster, encyclopedia, etc.:
examples: You broke another pair of glasses? You're just a walking disaster!

definitions.definition: a journey that you make by walking, often for enjoyment:
examples: He went for/took a walk around the block, to get some air.

definitions.definition: a path or route where people can walk for enjoyment:
examples: Do you know any nice walks around here?
He has a strange waddling sort of walk.
She slowed the horses to a walk.

definitions.definition: a journey that takes a short time, five minutes, ten minutes, etc. when you walk:
examples: The school is only a five-minute walk away.

definitions.definition: in baseball, an occasion when a batter is allowed to go to first base after the pitcher has thrown the ball outside the hitting area four times
